A EU grant has been provided to the FCTC Secretariat to support and enhance implementation of the FCTC. This will be complementary to FCTC core budget. The total cost is EUR 7.5 million whereas the EU contribution is 5.2 million (70%). The period is from 31/12/2011 – 30/12/2014.
• Main activities:
• Needs assessments in 30 states party to FCTC
• Regional knowledge and capacity building hubs for FCTC implementation
• Development of web-based portal to facilitate information sharing analysis and reporting on progress in FCTC implementation.
column3:
A new initiative has recently been launched to enhance implementation of the FCTC. This will be complementary to FCTC core budget. The total cost is EUR 7.5 million whereas the EU contribution is 5.2 million (70%). The period is from 31/12/2011 - 30/12/2014.
o Main activities:
o Needs assessments in 30 states party to FCTC
o Regional knowledge and capacitybuilding hubs for FCTC implementation
o Development of web-based portal to facilitate information sharing analysis and reporting on progress in FCTC implementation.

-After the 5th session of Conference of the Parties of WHO FCTC which was held on 12 to 17 November in Seoul Korean government donated the rest of conference hosting budget to FCTC Secretariat for promoting the relevant activities of Protocol to Eliminate Illicit Trade in Tobacco Products.
* Purpose: Implementation of activities related to the Protocol 
* Total: USD 151 714 
- Korea National Cancer Center planned and implemented the international training workshop for professionals in the Asia-Pacific region sharing the best practices and experience of quitline. This training program was held in July 2012 endorsed by WPRO.
column3:
In 2011 Asian Pacific Quitline Network(APQW) was activated and expanded their role to encourage other countris to develop their own Quitline based on the FCTC article 14
As a follow up to the APQW in 2012 leadership training workshop was planned and under process for country representatives where the development or improvement of Quitline is under the consideration by National Cancer Center of Korea and WPRO

column3: En septiembre de 2011 España participó en la Reunión de Alto Nivel de la Asamblea General de las Naciones Unidas sobre la Prevención y el Control de las Enfermedades no Transmisibles. En la Declaración Política resultante en los artículos 47 a 52 se insta a desarrollar diversas medidas para que se cumplan todos los compromisos de ayuda oficial para el desarrollo y se movilicen recursos financieros suficientes previsibles y sostenidos encaminados a fortalecer la cooperación para el desarrollo relativa a la prevención y control de las enfermedades no transmisibles (resolución EB130/6 del Consejo Ejecutivo de la OMS y documento A/66/L.1 de la Asamblea General de las Naciones Unidas).
